Trump makes U-turn on Ukraine and lectures Europeans at the UN
subhead: The US president made a dramatic reversal on his own position regarding the war in Ukraine on Tuesday, declaring that Kyiv 'is in a position to fight and win all of Ukraine back in its original form.' Speaking at the United Nations, he criticized European countries' migration and energy policies.

At Musée d'Orsay, John Singer Sargent, an American in Paris
subhead: While revered by major museums internationally, the painter remains little known in France. Focusing on his Paris years, his first exhibition seeks to correct that oversight.

title: Iran meets Europeans but no compromise over nuclear program as Tehran pushes back
subhead: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has until Saturday to reach a deal with his British, French, German and EU counterparts to avoid reinstatement of UN sanctions. Meanwhile, French President Emmanuel Macron said he will meet with Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian on Wednesday to continue talks.

title: Vivian Jenna Wilson, Elon Musk's transgender daughter, has become a New York Fashion Week sensation
subhead: The billionaire's daughter, who is transgender and estranged from her father, made a splash during New York Fashion Week in mid-September. At 21, her rising profile and outspoken positions have become a source of encouragement for a community that has faced adversity under the Trump administration.

title: Alexus Grynkewich, top NATO commander in Europe: 'Russia has always tried to maneuver for advantage over the alliance'
subhead: As the repercussions of the war in Ukraine increasingly impact Europe, NATO's new supreme allied commander Europe explains the measures aimed at countering any actions that target NATO member states.
byline: Chloé Hoorman,  Elise Vincent and  Philippe Jacqué

subhead: The right pretends not to see that the ultra-rich are not paying their fair share. The left, meanwhile, is blindly accepting an idea that is solely academic in nature, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: In Italy, tens of thousands hold protests in solidarity with Gaza
subhead: Tens of thousands of people took to the streets across Italy on Monday to 'condemn the genocide in Gaza,' during a day of protests marked by strikes and blockades organized by several unions, echoing the slogan of the French protest movement, Block Everything.

title: Dan Ben-David, economist: 'Israel has broken the roots of its growth'
subhead: The professor at Tel Aviv University warns that years of underinvestment, especially in education, and the rising influence of religious Jews are pushing Israel toward an existential crisis.
